question.title: MapStruct not mapping nested fields without explicit mappings when multiple source parameters are present
question.body:
I have two similar DTO classes and a MapStruct mapper. When mapping from one object with additional String parameters, nested fields aren't mapped automatically â€” they become null unless explicitly defined.

Important context: This simplified example illustrates a real problem in my project where I have to write 14 explicit @Mapping annotations just to map nested fields that should be auto-mapped. I'm looking for a way to avoid this boilerplate.

Source Classes:

@Getter
@Setter
@AllArgsConstructor
@NoArgsConstructor
public class MyHome {
    private Bathroom bathroomInfo;
    private Bedroom bedroomInfo;
    private Kitchen kitchenInfo;

    @Getter @Setter @AllArgsConstructor @NoArgsConstructor
    public static class Bathroom { private String shower; }

    @Getter @Setter @AllArgsConstructor @NoArgsConstructor
    public static class Bedroom { private String bed; }

    @Getter @Setter @AllArgsConstructor @NoArgsConstructor
    public static class Kitchen { private String diningTable; }
}

@Getter
@Setter
@AllArgsConstructor
@NoArgsConstructor
public class MyFriendHome {
    private Bathroom bathroomInfo;
    private Bedroom bedroomInfo;
    private Kitchen kitchenInfo;

    @Getter @Setter @AllArgsConstructor @NoArgsConstructor
    public static class Bathroom { 
        private String shower;
        private String nightstand;
        private String sink;
    }

    @Getter @Setter @AllArgsConstructor @NoArgsConstructor
    public static class Bedroom { private String bed; }

    @Getter @Setter @AllArgsConstructor @NoArgsConstructor
    public static class Kitchen { private String diningTable; }
}

Mapper Interface:

@Mapper(
    componentModel = MappingConstants.ComponentModel.SPRING,
    unmappedTargetPolicy = ReportingPolicy.ERROR
)
public interface HomeMapper {
    
    @Mapping(target = "bathroomInfo.shower", source = "myHome.bathroomInfo.shower")
    @Mapping(target = "bathroomInfo.nightstand", source = "nightstand")
    @Mapping(target = "bathroomInfo.sink", source = "sink")
    MyFriendHome toMyFriendHome(MyHome myHome, String nightstand, String sink);
}

Usage:

@GetMapping
public MyFriendHome getMyFriendHome() {
    MyHome home = new MyHome(
        new MyHome.Bathroom("shower"),
        new MyHome.Bedroom("bed"),
        new MyHome.Kitchen("kitchen")
    );
    return homeMapper.toMyFriendHome(home, "nightstand", "sink");
}

Problem:
If I remove the explicit mapping for bathroomInfo.shower:

// @Mapping(target = "bathroomInfo.shower", source = "myHome.bathroomInfo.shower")

The shower field becomes null in the result. Only nightstand and sink get populated. However, bedroomInfo and kitchenInfo (which have matching field names and types) are mapped automatically without any explicit mappings.

In my actual project, this forces me to write numerous @Mapping annotations for fields that should be auto-mapped by convention.

Question:
Why doesn't MapStruct automatically map myHome.bathroomInfo.shower to bathroomInfo.shower when there are multiple source parameters, while it successfully maps other nested objects (bedroomInfo, kitchenInfo)?

Is this expected behavior with multiple source parameters? How can I configure the mapper to handle nested field mappings automatically in this scenario and avoid writing dozens of explicit @Mapping annotations?
